step1.title: The Suspicious Email
step1.description: You receive an email claiming to be from your bank asking you to verify your account details immediately.
step1.situation: The email looks official but something feels off. It's asking for your login credentials and mentions urgent security concerns.
step1.question: How do you respond to this email?
step1.optionA: Click the link and verify your account to be safe
step1.optionB: Ignore the email and contact your bank directly
step1.optionC: Forward the email to your bank's security team
step1.explanationA: Clicking links in suspicious emails can lead to phishing attacks and credential theft.
step1.explanationB: This is the safest approach - always contact your bank through official channels.
step1.explanationC: Good thinking! Reporting suspicious emails helps protect others.
step1.consequenceA: Your credentials are stolen and your account is compromised.
step1.consequenceB: Your account remains secure and you avoid the phishing attempt.
step1.consequenceC: The bank investigates and blocks the phishing campaign.

step2.title: The Urgent Request
step2.description: A colleague calls you asking for immediate help with a work emergency, requesting sensitive information.
step2.situation: The person sounds like your colleague but the request seems unusual and urgent. They're asking for passwords and access codes.
step2.question: What do you do in this situation?
step2.optionA: Help immediately since it's an emergency
step2.optionB: Verify their identity first through a separate channel
step2.optionC: Ask them to contact IT support instead
step2.explanationA: Never share sensitive information without proper verification, even in emergencies.
step2.explanationB: Always verify identity through known secure channels before sharing sensitive data.
step2.explanationC: IT support is the appropriate channel for handling security-related requests.
step2.consequenceA: Sensitive information is compromised and used for unauthorized access.
step2.consequenceB: You verify the request is legitimate and help appropriately.
step2.consequenceC: The request is handled through proper channels with appropriate security measures.

step3.title: The Software Update
step3.description: You receive a popup notification about a critical security update for your computer.
step3.situation: The popup looks legitimate but appeared while browsing an unfamiliar website. It's asking you to download and install immediately.
step3.question: How do you handle this software update notification?
step3.optionA: Download and install immediately to stay secure
step3.optionB: Close the popup and ignore it completely
step3.optionC: Check for updates through your system's official update mechanism
step3.explanationA: Downloading software from popups can install malware disguised as legitimate updates.
step3.explanationB: Ignoring all update notifications can leave you vulnerable to real security threats.
step3.explanationC: Always use official update mechanisms to ensure you get legitimate security updates.
step3.consequenceA: Malware is installed on your system, compromising your security.
step3.consequenceB: You miss legitimate updates and remain vulnerable to known security issues.
step3.consequenceC: You receive legitimate security updates through secure channels.

securitySandbox.title: AI Security Sandbox
securitySandbox.subtitle: See how WALRUS defends against Prompt Injection attacks in real-time.
securitySandbox.apiNotConfigured: API not configured - Using fallback responses
securitySandbox.promptLeakingDesc: This tries to trick the AI into exposing its secret instructions.
securitySandbox.functionHijackingDesc: This attempts to make the AI ignore its main job and do something else entirely.
securitySandbox.falseInfoDesc: This tries to make the AI generate a completely incorrect and misleading analysis.
securitySandbox.demonstrationText: The "Unsecured AI" uses a basic prompt that is easily manipulated by the attack. The "WALRUS Secured AI" uses a hardened system prompt that resists manipulation and correctly analyzes the malicious input itself, showing its superior security.

mapPicker.title: Select Location
mapPicker.placeholder: Enter pincode (574110) or search location (Bangalore, Karnataka)
mapPicker.noLocationsFound: No locations found. Try a different search term.
mapPicker.enterPincode: Enter 6-digit pincode (e.g., 574110) for auto-fetch from postal database
mapPicker.searchPostOffice: Search post office names (e.g., "New Delhi GPO", "Bangalore GPO")
mapPicker.focusKarnataka: Focus on Karnataka locations for best results
mapPicker.includeCityState: Include city and state for better results
mapPicker.tryDifferentSpellings: Try different spellings if no results found
